snippet: Decades before he signed Jackie Robinson, Branch Rickey said he was moved by an incident involving a black catcher, Charles Thomas, at Ohio Wesleyan University.
abstract: Box Seats article by Prof Chris Lamb conveys that decades before Brooklyn Dodgers president Branch Rickey signed Jackie Robinson, Rickey was moved as a coach at Ohio Wesleyan University by an incident involving catcher Charles Thomas, the team's only black player.
lead_paragraph: Decades before he signed Jackie Robinson, Branch Rickey said he was moved by an incident involving a black catcher, Charles Thomas, at Ohio Wesleyan University.

headline.seo: Branch Rickey Found Inspiration in Catcher’s Tears
headline.main: Catcher’s Tears Were a Likely Inspiration for Rickey
headline.print_headline: Catcher’s Tears Were a Likely Inspiration For Rickey
